The Ultimate Guide to REI Hiking Clothes: Expert Reviews & Best Picks for 2024

After 12+ years of testing hiking gear across diverse terrains from the Pacific Northwest's rainforests to Arizona's desert trails, I've learned that choosing the right rei hiking clothes can make or break your outdoor adventure. This comprehensive guide combines my field experience with expert analysis to help you build the perfect hiking wardrobe. Explore our complete outdoor gear collection here.

Table of Contents

  • Why Choose REI Hiking Clothes?
  • Understanding the Layering System
  • Essential REI Hiking Clothes Every Hiker Needs
  • Seasonal Hiking Clothes Guide
  • My 12-Year Experience with REI Gear
  • Budget-Friendly Alternatives to REI
  • Frequently Asked Questions
  • Conclusion

Why Choose REI Hiking Clothes?

When I first started hiking in the early 2010s, I made the classic beginner mistake of wearing cotton t-shirts and jeans. After getting caught in a sudden downpour during a Mount Rainier day hike, I learned the hard way why fabric choice matters. That experience led me to REI, where I discovered the importance of technical outdoor clothing.

REI has earned its reputation as America's premier outdoor retailer through decades of innovation and field-tested gear. Their co-op model means they're invested in creating products that actually work for real outdoor enthusiasts, not just marketing hype. After testing hundreds of pieces from various brands, I consistently return to REI hiking clothes for their reliability and performance.

Watch: REI Expert Guide to Hiking Clothes

Key Advantages of REI Hiking Clothes:

  • Field-Tested Design: Developed by outdoor experts who actually use the gear
  • Lifetime Satisfaction Guarantee: Return anything, anytime if you're not satisfied
  • Member Benefits: Co-op members receive annual dividends and exclusive access to sales
  • Sustainable Practices: Commitment to environmental responsibility and fair labor practices
  • Expert Staff: Knowledgeable employees who can provide personalized recommendations

During my years of testing, I've found that REI's house brand offers exceptional value compared to premium outdoor brands while maintaining professional-grade performance. Their Sahara line, in particular, has been my go-to for desert hiking, while the Trailmade collection excels in temperate climates. The brand's focus on versatile, multi-season pieces means you can build a complete hiking wardrobe without breaking the bank.

Understanding the Layering System

The layering system is the foundation of effective outdoor clothing. I learned this principle during a challenging backpacking trip in the North Cascades, where temperatures swung from 75°F during the day to 35°F at night. Without proper layering, I would have been either overheating or freezing throughout the journey.

Base Layer

Your next-to-skin layer manages moisture and regulates temperature. Choose merino wool for natural odor resistance or synthetic materials for quick-drying performance.

Best REI Options:
  • • Merino 185 Long-Sleeve Base Layer
  • • Active Pursuits T-Shirt
  • • Sahara Shade Hoodie

Mid Layer

Provides insulation and traps warm air. Fleece and down pieces are ideal for this layer, offering warmth without excessive bulk.

Best REI Options:
  • • Trailmade Fleece Jacket
  • • 650 Down Jacket
  • • Trailmade Insulated Hoodie

Outer Layer

Protects against wind, rain, and external elements. Look for waterproof-breathable fabrics that keep you dry while allowing moisture to escape.

Best REI Options:
  • • Rainier Rain Jacket
  • • Trailmade Rain Jacket
  • • Rainier Long Line Rain Jacket

Pro Tip from the Trail

During a week-long trek through Olympic National Park, I learned that having the right layering system is more important than having the most expensive gear. A $40 REI base layer performed better than my $120 designer hiking shirt because it was designed for the specific conditions I encountered. Always prioritize function over fashion when selecting rei hiking clothes.

The key to successful layering is versatility. Each piece should work independently and in combination with others. I typically start my hikes wearing just a base layer and carry my mid and outer layers in my pack. This approach has served me well on countless adventures, from single-day hikes to multi-week expeditions.

Essential REI Hiking Clothes Every Hiker Needs

After years of testing and countless miles on the trail, I've identified the core pieces that form the foundation of any hiking wardrobe. These items have proven themselves across different climates, seasons, and trail conditions. Let me walk you through each essential category and my top recommendations.

REI Co-op Sahara Shade Hoodie

4.6/5 (1,047 reviews)

This has been my go-to sun protection piece for desert and high-altitude hiking. The UPF 50+ rating and flip-up collar have saved me from countless sunburns during summer hikes in the Southwest.

Check Price on Amazon

REI Co-op Trailmade Pants

4.6/5 (852 reviews)

These pants strike the perfect balance between durability and comfort. I've worn them on rocky scrambles and brushy trails, and they've held up remarkably well while maintaining excellent freedom of movement.

Check Price on Amazon

Patagonia Torrentshell 3L Jacket

4.4/5 (178 reviews)

While not REI's house brand, this jacket is consistently available at REI and has been my trusted rain protection for over 5 years. It's withstood torrential downpours in the Pacific Northwest and kept me dry and comfortable.

Check Price on Amazon

Darn Tough Hiker Micro Crew Cushion Socks

4.8/5 (689 reviews)

These merino wool socks have never given me a blister, even on 20+ mile days. The lifetime guarantee is real – I've had pairs replaced after years of use, no questions asked.

Check Price on Amazon

Complete REI Hiking Wardrobe Checklist

Upper Body

  • • Moisture-wicking base layer shirt
  • • Sun protection hoodie (UPF 50+)
  • • Fleece or insulated mid-layer
  • • Waterproof rain jacket
  • • Brimmed hat for sun protection

Lower Body & Feet

  • • Quick-dry hiking pants
  • • Convertible zip-off pants (optional)
  • • Moisture-wicking underwear
  • • Merino wool hiking socks
  • • Lightweight gloves (for altitude)

Building your REI hiking clothes collection doesn't happen overnight. I recommend starting with a few key pieces and gradually expanding your wardrobe based on your hiking style and local conditions. Quality over quantity should always be your guiding principle – it's better to have three excellent pieces than ten mediocre ones.

Seasonal Hiking Clothes Guide

One of the biggest lessons I've learned over the years is that there's no such thing as bad weather, only inappropriate clothing. Each season brings unique challenges that require specific gear adaptations. Here's how I modify my rei hiking clothes setup throughout the year.

Spring Hiking (March-May)

Spring hiking means unpredictable weather. During a memorable April hike in the Columbia River Gorge, I experienced everything from snow flurries to blazing sunshine in a single day.

Essential Spring Layers:

  • • Base layer: Merino wool long-sleeve
  • • Mid layer: Lightweight fleece
  • • Outer layer: Waterproof rain jacket
  • • Bottom: Quick-dry pants with rain pants backup
  • • Accessories: Beanie and lightweight gloves

Summer Hiking (June-August)

Summer hiking is all about sun protection and cooling. My worst hiking experience involved severe sunburn during a Zion National Park hike because I underestimated UV exposure at high altitude.

Essential Summer Gear:

  • • Base layer: UPF 50+ long-sleeve hoodie
  • • Bottom: Lightweight hiking pants or shorts
  • • Hat: Wide-brimmed sun hat
  • • Emergency: Lightweight rain jacket
  • • Cooling: Moisture-wicking bandana

Fall Hiking (September-November)

Fall offers some of the best hiking weather, but temperature swings can be dramatic. During an October backpacking trip in the Cascades, morning temperatures were 28°F while afternoon highs reached 68°F.

Essential Fall Layers:

  • • Base layer: Midweight merino wool
  • • Mid layer: Insulated vest or jacket
  • • Outer layer: Wind-resistant softshell
  • • Bottom: Thermal underwear + hiking pants
  • • Accessories: Warm hat and gloves

Winter Hiking (December-February)

Winter hiking demands respect and proper preparation. A close call during a Mount Hood winter climb taught me never to compromise on insulation and weather protection.

Essential Winter System:

  • • Base layer: Heavyweight thermal system
  • • Mid layer: Down or synthetic insulation
  • • Outer layer: Waterproof hardshell jacket
  • • Bottom: Thermal base + softshell pants
  • • Extremities: Insulated gloves, warm hat, gaiters

Critical Safety Note

Weather conditions can change rapidly in the mountains. Always carry extra layers regardless of the forecast. During a "perfect weather" summer day on Mount Whitney, unexpected afternoon thunderstorms dropped temperatures 40 degrees and brought hail. My extra fleece layer literally saved me from hypothermia.

The key to seasonal success is adaptability. I've learned to check not just the weather forecast, but also elevation profiles, regional climate patterns, and historical weather data for my hiking destinations. This preparation has allowed me to stay comfortable and safe across thousands of miles and countless adventures.

My 12-Year Experience with REI Gear

Trail Credentials

Over 12 years of hiking experience across 15+ states, from the Appalachian Trail to the Pacific Crest Trail. Former REI employee (2018-2020) with hands-on testing of hundreds of gear pieces. Completed over 200 day hikes and 50+ multi-day backpacking trips.

My relationship with REI began in 2012 when I bought my first "real" hiking outfit after that disastrous Mount Rainier experience. Since then, I've tested virtually every piece in their hiking clothing line, often pushing gear to its limits in challenging conditions. Here are my most important discoveries:

The Great REI Sahara Test: Death Valley, 2019

I put the REI Sahara line to the ultimate test during a 5-day backpacking trip in Death Valley. Daytime temperatures reached 115°F while nights dropped to 45°F. The Sahara Shade Hoodie became my most valuable piece – its UPF 50+ rating prevented sunburn while the loose fit provided essential air circulation.

Result: Zero sunburn, maintained core temperature, no fabric failure after 5 days of extreme conditions.

Pacific Northwest Rain Test: Olympic Peninsula, 2020

During a notoriously wet October on the Olympic Peninsula, my REI Rainier Rain Jacket faced 3 consecutive days of heavy rain. While hiking partners in other brands experienced wet-through conditions, I stayed completely dry. The jacket's breathability prevented the "sauna effect" common with cheaper rain gear.

Result: Stayed dry through 15+ hours of heavy precipitation, excellent breathability during strenuous uphill sections.

Durability Challenge: Appalachian Trail Section, 2021

I wore the same REI Trailmade Pants for 300+ miles of the Appalachian Trail, including notoriously rocky sections in Pennsylvania and Virginia. Despite constant contact with thorns, rocks, and rough surfaces, the pants showed minimal wear and maintained their water-repelling treatment.

Result: Exceptional durability with only minor pilling after 300+ miles. No tears, maintained water resistance.

What I Love About REI Hiking Clothes

  • Consistent quality across all price points
  • Excellent customer service and return policy
  • Thoughtful design details based on real-world use
  • Sustainable manufacturing practices
  • Great value compared to premium outdoor brands
  • Size inclusive options for all body types

Areas for Improvement

  • Limited fashion-forward styling options
  • Some pieces run large – size down recommended
  • Not always the lightest option for ultralight backpacking
  • Color selections can be limited
  • Premium features sometimes reserved for higher-end lines
  • Stock availability can be inconsistent

User Reviews from the Trail Community

Sarah M. - Amazon Verified Purchase

"I've used the REI Sahara Shade Hoodie on over 50 hikes in Arizona and Utah. The sun protection is incredible and it's held up perfectly after 2+ years of regular use. Worth every penny for desert hiking."

Mike T. - Reddit r/hiking

"REI Trailmade Pants are my go-to for everything from day hikes to multi-day backpacking. Comfortable, durable, and the fit is perfect. I own three pairs now and they're all holding up great."

Jessica L. - Quora Hiking Community

"As a plus-size hiker, I appreciate that REI offers extended sizes that actually fit properly. The quality is consistent across all sizes, and the customer service is exceptional when I need exchanges."

After more than a decade of testing, I consistently recommend REI hiking clothes to beginners and experienced hikers alike. They offer the reliability you need on the trail without the premium price tag of luxury outdoor brands. While they may not be the absolute lightest or most fashion-forward option, they excel where it matters most: performance, durability, and value.

Budget-Friendly Alternatives to REI

While I'm a strong advocate for REI gear, I understand that budget constraints are real. During my college years, I had to be creative about building my hiking wardrobe on a tight budget. Here are the best alternatives I've discovered that offer similar performance at lower price points.

Money-Saving Strategies I Use

  • REI Garage Sales: Score returned items at 50-70% off retail
  • Member Dividend: REI co-op membership pays for itself with 10% annual dividends
  • Seasonal Sales: End-of-season clearance events offer huge savings
  • Used Gear Markets: Facebook Marketplace and REI Re/Supply for quality used items
  • Try Before You Buy: REI's generous return policy lets you test gear thoroughly

When to Splurge vs Save

Worth the Investment

  • • Rain jacket (your life may depend on it)
  • • Base layers (comfort and safety)
  • • Hiking socks (prevent blisters and injuries)
  • • Insulation layer (core temperature regulation)

Safe to Save Money

  • • Casual hiking shirts (for easy trails)
  • • Hiking shorts (for day hikes only)
  • • Sun hats (unless extreme conditions)
  • • Casual hiking pants (for established trails)

My advice for budget-conscious hikers is to start with one quality piece in each category and upgrade over time. I still use a $15 synthetic base layer I bought in 2015 for certain conditions, while my $150 rain jacket has saved me countless times in severe weather. The key is understanding which pieces are critical for your safety and comfort versus nice-to-have upgrades.

Remember that the best rei hiking clothes are the ones you actually wear on the trail. I've seen hikers with thousands of dollars in gear sitting at home while others make do with budget alternatives and have incredible adventures. Focus on getting outside and gaining experience – you can always upgrade your gear as your skills and knowledge grow.

Frequently Asked Questions

What makes REI hiking clothes better than regular athletic wear?

REI hiking clothes are specifically designed for outdoor environments and extended wear. Unlike regular athletic wear, they feature UV protection, abrasion-resistant materials, and specialized fits for pack-wearing. The fabric treatments repel water and resist odors better than typical gym clothes. After testing both extensively, I've found that REI clothes maintain their performance characteristics longer and provide better protection against the elements. The thoughtful design details like reinforced stress points and strategic ventilation make a significant difference during long hiking days.

How do REI hiking clothes fit compared to regular clothing sizes?

REI clothes generally run true to size, but with a slightly relaxed fit designed for layering and movement. I typically wear the same size in REI as I do in regular brands, but I recommend checking their detailed size charts since fit varies by product line. The Sahara line tends to be more generous, while the Trailmade line is more fitted. REI's generous return policy makes it easy to exchange sizes, and their customer service team can provide specific fit guidance based on your measurements and intended use.

Are REI brand clothes worth the price compared to budget alternatives?

In my experience, REI clothes offer excellent value for their price point, sitting between budget outdoor wear and premium brands like Patagonia or Arc'teryx. The quality is consistently high, and the lifetime satisfaction guarantee provides peace of mind. While you can find cheaper alternatives, I've found that REI clothes last longer and perform better in challenging conditions. For serious hikers who are on the trail regularly, the durability and performance justify the cost. However, casual day hikers might find budget alternatives sufficient for their needs.

What's the best way to care for and maintain REI hiking clothes?

Proper care significantly extends the life of hiking clothes. I wash REI garments in cold water with technical fabric detergent (like Nikwax or Grangers) and avoid fabric softeners which can damage moisture-wicking properties. Air drying is preferred, but low heat tumble drying is usually safe. For DWR-treated items like rain jackets, periodic treatment renewal with spray-on DWR restores water repellency. I've found that following care instructions religiously has kept some pieces performing like new after 5+ years of regular use.

Can REI hiking clothes work for other outdoor activities besides hiking?

Absolutely! REI hiking clothes are incredibly versatile for various outdoor activities. I regularly use my hiking pants for camping, fishing, and even casual wear. The moisture-wicking properties make them excellent for cycling and climbing, while the sun protection is valuable for any outdoor sport. The durable construction handles bushwhacking, rock scrambling, and other rough activities well. Many pieces transition nicely from trail to town, making them excellent travel clothes for outdoor-focused trips.

How often should I replace my REI hiking clothes?

The replacement timeline depends on usage frequency and care. My most-used REI base layers last 2-3 years with weekly use, while my rain jacket is still going strong after 6 years. Signs it's time to replace include loss of moisture-wicking properties, persistent odors that won't wash out, fabric thinning, or failure of technical features like DWR coating that can't be renewed. I typically replace items when they stop performing their intended function rather than based on appearance alone. REI's satisfaction guarantee means you can return items that fail prematurely.

Conclusion

After 12 years and thousands of miles on the trail, I can confidently say that investing in quality rei hiking clothes has transformed my outdoor experiences. From that first disaster on Mount Rainier to successfully completing challenging multi-day expeditions, the right clothing has been the foundation of every successful adventure.

Key Takeaways for Your Hiking Wardrobe

  • Start with core pieces: base layer, hiking pants, and rain protection
  • Prioritize function over fashion – comfort and safety come first
  • Understand the layering system for versatility across conditions
  • Consider your local climate and typical hiking conditions
  • Take advantage of REI's generous return policy to find your perfect fit

The outdoor clothing market offers countless options, from budget alternatives to premium luxury brands. Through extensive testing and real-world experience, I've found that REI strikes the perfect balance of performance, durability, and value. Their clothes have kept me comfortable and safe through desert heat, mountain storms, and everything in between.

Ready to Upgrade Your Hiking Wardrobe?

Whether you're planning your first day hike or preparing for a major expedition, having the right clothing makes all the difference. Start with one quality piece and build your collection over time based on your hiking style and local conditions.

Shop REI on Amazon Visit Our Gear Store

Remember, the best hiking clothes are the ones that keep you comfortable, safe, and excited to get back on the trail. Invest wisely, care for your gear properly, and most importantly – get outside and start making memories. The mountains are waiting, and with the right rei hiking clothes, you'll be ready for whatever adventures lie ahead.
